info.title: bunny.net Edge Storage API
info.description:
![bunny.net Logo](https://bunny.net/v2/images/bunnynet-logo-dark.png "bunny.net Logo") Learn how to use the [bunny.net](https://bunny.net "bunny.net - The content delivery platform that truly hops") Edge Storage API. It allows you to easily upload, download and delete files with just a few lines of code.

API libraries:

These libraries allow quick integration for bunny.net Edge Storage.
  • BunnyCDN.PHP.Storage - Official PHP storage library
  • BunnyCDN.Net.Storage - Official .NET storage library
  • BunnyCDN.Java.Storage - Official Java storage library
  • Python Storage Library - (Unofficial)

Storage Endpoints:

The storage API endpoint depends on the primary storage region of your storage zone. You can also find this in the FTP & HTTP API Information of your storage zone.
  • Falkenstein: storage.bunnycdn.com
  • New York: la.storage.bunnycdn.com
  • Los Angeles: la.storage.bunnycdn.com
  • Singapore: sg.storage.bunnycdn.com
  • Sydney: syd.storage.bunnycdn.com

get.description: Returns the stored file at the given path. If the file does not exist, a 404 response will be returned.

parameters.name: storageZoneName
parameters.description: The name of your storage zone where you are connecting to.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path to your file. If this is the root of your storage zone, you can ignore this parameter.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file that you wish to download.

parameters.name: AccessKey
parameters.description: The API AccessKey used for authentication.

200.description: Returns the file stored at the given path.

404.description: The file on the given path does not exist.

put.description: Upload a file to a storage zone based on the URL path. If the directory tree does not exist, it will be created automatically. **The file content should be sent as the body of the request without any type of encoding.**

requestBody.description: Raw request body should contain the contents of the file. This should be raw file data without any sort of encoding.

parameters.name: storageZoneName
parameters.description: he name of your storage zone where you are connecting to.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path to where your file will be stored. If this is the root of your storage zone, you can ignore this parameter.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name that the file will be uploaded as.

parameters.name: Checksum
parameters.description: The SHA256 checksum of the uploaded content. The server will compare the final SHA256 to the checksum and reject the request in case the checksums do not match.

parameters.name: AccessKey
parameters.description: The API AccessKey used for authentication.

delete.description: Delete an object from the storage zone. In case the object is a directory all the data in it will be recursively deleted as well.

parameters.name: storageZoneName
parameters.description: The name of your storage zone where you are connecting to.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path to your file. If this is the root of your storage zone, you can ignore this parameter.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file that you wish to delete.

parameters.name: AccessKey
parameters.description: The API AccessKey used for authentication.

get.description: Retrieve a list of files and directories located in the given directory.

parameters.name: storageZoneName
parameters.description: he name of your storage zone where you are connecting to.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path that you want to list.

200.description: A JSON encoded array of objects.

AccessKeyAuthentication.name: AccessKey
AccessKeyAuthentication.description: The storage zone password also doubles as your API key. You can find it in your storage zone details page in the bunny.net dashboard.

HttpCode.description: The error status code of the request

Guid.description: The unique Guid that represents the file

Path.description: True directory path where the object is located

ObjectName.description: The name of the object, file or directory name

LastChanged.description: The time when the file was last changed

IsDirectory.description: True if this is a directory object, false if it's a file

ServerId.description: The ID of the physical server that holds the file

UserId.description: The ID of the user that holds the file

DateCreated.description: The date and time when the object was first created

StorageZoneId.description: The storage zone ID to which the file belongs
